Title: Print and eBook Legal Publications Framework Agreement
Description:
The judicial library and information service (JLIS) provide legal publications and information to judges and legal advisers to ensure that they are equipped to carry out their duties effectively.

Provision varies depending on jurisdiction, but in general terms, JLIS currently provides: print, ebooks.

The legal publication print and eBook framework is divided into 2 lots:

- Lot 1: POF Titles (publication order form) - titles chosen by JLIS prior to the start of the financial year and additionally may be required throughout the course of the financial year. This will contain core titles and additional miscellaneous requirements. Exact titles are subject to change year-on-year,

- Lot 2: UXB (unexpected books) - ad-hoc requests throughout the financial year for miscellaneous publications not listed in Lot 1. Exact titles are subject to change year-on-year.
Additional Text: The attached Framework Agreement includes the specification for the requirement and the tender response form. Call off Contracts will be published on Contracts Finder as they are let.

Title: Online Legal Resources Framework Agreement
Description:
The Ministry of Justice and other participating departments require access to a comprehensive range of legal information, including legislation, case law, commentary and current awareness. This information is required in a variety of formations including online, print and eBook.

This online legal resources framework is divided into 2 lots.

Lot 1: JLIS specific requirements (based on number of users);

Lot 2: GLD specific requirements (based on number of licences needed).

The following online content from across the range of legal publishers is available via the framework;

- legislation - original and consolidated,

- case law, law reports and transcripts - including archives back to 13th century,

- current awareness services which enable judges to keep up to date with changes to the law,

- journals,

- commentary - textbooks and loose-leaf - current editions and supplements,

- practice area tools.
Additional Text: Attached document includes the Specification and the  tender response form. Individual call off contracts will be published on Contracts Finder as they are let.

Title: Framework for the Provision of Legal Publications - Print and eBook
Description:
The MoJ Library and Information Service (jLIS) and other participating departments require current legal information in Print and eBook format from all legal publishers in the UK, and on occasion, overseas publishers. For the MoJ, this is predominantly about the provision of a core collection of approximately 500 legal publications which includes books, loose leafs, law reports and journals. Details of these core titles will be made available in the tender documents.
Many of these titles are required in large quantities as they are provided to all judges, courts and tribunals. Other publications will be required on an ad hoc basis and quantities will vary.
The tender process will result in framework agreements with a duration of 4 years.
Additional Text:
The Ministry of Justice will be performing events through its e-Sourcing Portal. The e-Sourcing Portal is an online application that allows all potential suppliers to create and submit their responses to any to any Requests for Information, Request for Quotes or Requests for Proposals via the internet rather than in paper form (where they have been invited to respond). To express an interest in this event, please send an email to: helen.wood2@justice.gsi.gov.uk stating:

1. Company Name,
2. Your Name,
3. Contact email,
4. Sourcing Reference Number: 3952 - Operational Goods- N- RFP.
The buyer will then contact you with the registration process, if you are not already registered on the Ministry of Justice e-Sourcing portal.
